page.title: 15CRABAPPLE COMMUNE,BERRINGTON
page.content: {Berrington Hall}was built in 1843 as the{Rectory}for the Parish. It ceased as the Rectory in 1927. In 1975 the Hall and land was purchased by a {Commune Group.}This group is{Crabapple {Commune}and has 9 adults and 2 children. The commune is an{alternative}way of living. They aim to live their lives communally and to share resources and commodities. The members all have some similar outlooks on life and support such activities as Greenpeace, Friends of the Earth, C.N.D., and the Peace Camps. Crabapple{own}20 acres of{land}on which is grown cereals and vegetables for their own consumption. They also have 5 cattle, 15 sheep and 76 fowl. They own and run a{wholefood shop}in Shrewsbury called{Crabapple}which provides income for the commune.
